alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 12 at 12:37PM CST until December 14 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ TUESDAY TO 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Northwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...In Colorado, Yuma, Kit Carson and Cheyenne Counties. In Kansas, Cheyenne, Sherman, Wallace and Greeley Counties. In Nebraska, Dundy County. * WHEN...From 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Tuesday to 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ Wednesday. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property and cause power outages. Travel will be difficult especially for high profile vehicles. The reduced visibility in the blowing snow may lead to dangerous driving conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The high winds combined with moderate to heavy snowfall will lead to blizzard like conditions for Yuma County. Blizzard like conditions may continue into Wednesday despite the snow ending Tuesday afternoon.
info.instruction: People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind.
